content.en: SST Algorithm Evaluation: Scientists have been studying the limitations and characteristics of various algorithms used to estimate sea surface temperature (SST) from satellite data. They have investigated algorithms developed by organizations such as NOAA, MODIS, MTSAT, SEVIRI, AVHRR, ATSR, SVISSR/FY-2C/D/E, VIIRS, AMSR2, Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer, FY-3C, AMSR-E, Himawari-8/AHI, ECOSTRESS, and VIIRS-N20. The goal is to improve the accuracy and reliability of SST measurements, which are important for understanding climate change and oceanic processes.
content.da: SST-algoritmevaluering: Forskere har studeret begrænsningerne og egenskaberne ved forskellige algoritmer, der anvendes til at estimere havoverfladetemperatur (SST) fra satellitdata. De har undersøgt algoritmer udviklet af organisationer som NOAA, MODIS, MTSAT, SEVIRI, AVHRR, ATSR, SVISSR/FY-2C/D/E, VIIRS, AMSR2, Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer, FY-3C, AMSR-E, Himawari-8/AHI, ECOSTRESS og VIIRS-N20. Målet er at forbedre nøjagtigheden og pålideligheden af SST-målinger, som er vigtige for at forstå klimaforandringer og oceaniske processer.
